title: John Boyega webchat âÂ your questions answered on Star Wars, Kathryn Bigelow and biscuits | Stage | The Guardian
summary: if i could play a superhero , i 'd one that no one 's heard about .
i 'm keen to work with kathryn bigelow again . i 've seen our movie now ( detroit ) and it 's heart-wrenching .
with film there 's no time to prepare â even on star wars . i went from star wars 8 to detroit then straight on to pacific rim .
my favourite role as a kid was master wobble in mrs wobble the waitress . i had to rollerblade across the stage and catch fake food in a big net .
if you come from a normal background and experience success , it takes a while to get your head around it . as long as it does n't come out in a negative way .
i get nervous on the first day only . i do n't have time for stage fright â it just weakens you .
post your questions for john boyega .

text: guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:17pm that 's it - big thank you to you all .
make sure you come down and see woyzeck at the old vic john boyega as woyzeck .
harlan
dwfan1 asks : what 's your favourite pixar film ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:15pm got to be toy story , the first one .
that cheet-os sequence
liam quane asks : what is the best thing a director can do for you on set ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:14pm the best thing they can do is just collaborate .
mrmodern asks : what 's life like between star wars films hopefully you can breathe and do other stuff ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:13pm i still have time to do the sort of stuff i used to do .
i just relax in my house , man !
romi2187 asks : do you read reviews ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:10pm i do but who cares though ?
it 's not that deep for me .
myam0t0 asks : beans on a fry up ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:09pm yeah .
but not too much - i do n't want to make the bread all soggy .
xandra11 asks : if you could play any acting role in any film from the past which one would you play ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:08pm sidney poitier , in the heat of the night .
that would be cool .
i 'm writing him a letter - i write letters to people i admire .
sidney poitier in in the heat of the night , with rod steiger .
stock photo

documents.title: if i could play a superhero , i 'd one that no one 's heard about
text: jellycar asks : if you could play any superhero , who would you guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:07pm i 'd a superhero that no one 's heard about .
there are many different ways of doing the superhero narrative and i 'm brainstorming some new ones for my company .
jellycar asks : what advice would you give to actors aspiring to work in the industry ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:06pm before any job comes training .
invest in the quality of training that you go through as an actor so that you can be ready for the auditions and the opportunities that come your way .
refitman asks : what 's your favourite biscuit ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:05pm hobnobs .
the chocolate ones .
philliplawler asks : what was the lousiest job you did before your acting took off and does it make you thankful for being in the position you are now in ?
i blackcurrants one summer , got sunburned and when i got home my mum fixed me a nice glass of ribena with a perfectly straight face .
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:04pm i do n't call them lousy - they all helped because they all paid !
they would fund my trips to la to audition for the films that you see me in today .
but despite that they were very frustrating at times - i was a model for college brochures .
i was an assistant to a theatre director .
at victoria station i gave out free samples and tasters .
kasem3000 asks : how do you feel about the continued lack of black and asian stories told in british cinema , at a time when the industry is doing so well ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 2:01pm i 've come to terms with my feelings about it .
now it 's more about what i 'm doing about it in my own way - hence having my own production company and having more control over the stories i want to tell .
because of my particular perspective , the stories i tell wo n't have just one kind of person in them .
warspite1944 asks : do you ever play with the action figure of you ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:59pm no .
lol we beg to differ john young/rex shutterstock
mightybuccaneer asks : will finn hold a lightsabre again and fight with one ?
finn 's duel with kylo ren was better choreographed than rey 's guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:58pm i hope so !
why not ?
boyega as finn in star war episode vii : the force awakens .
/allstar picture library
laurastans asks : how do you mentally prepare for playing a role as challenging as woyzeck ?
also silly question , but which hogwarts house are you in ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:57pm when i went to universal studios in la i did that thing where they put the hat on you and you your wand and i got slytherin !
i do n't know what that 's all about .

documents.title: with film there 's no time to prepare â even on star wars . i went from star wars 8 to detroit then straight on to pacific rim
text: jimijiminez asks : i was at the old vic tonight .
awesome performance , congratulations .
what are the main differences in preparing to play in a film or on stage ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:56pm with film there 's no time to prepare - even on star wars .
there were no rehearsals apart from the combat stuff , the fighting .
you ca n't have rehearsals on every film .
i went from star wars 8 straight on to detroit then straight on to pacific rim .
that 's how my year has been so far .
coming to the old vic and rehearsing for woyzeck felt like a mini-holiday !
woyzeck review john boyega shines as traumatised soldier in 80s berlin read more
gonegirlscat asks : you recently started your own company upper room productions , and i was wondering what kind of movies you want to produce ?
would it be only movies you will be starring in ?
best of luck with the play !
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:54pm only movies i 'm starring in ?
absolutely not .
when i 'm in meetings with my team , i 'm looking for stories from an interesting perspective - in the lineage of movies like her , comedies like 50:50 .
not the perspective of the leading superhero style guy but someone further on down the street .
mmjgdt asks : is there certain roles you 're more geared toward or if something sounds interesting will you take it ?
also , do you plan all those iconic instagram ahead of time or are your natural candids that perfect ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:52pm i like movies with some form of message or that sparks a form of conversation .
and they are that perfect - no planning necessary !
finnsrey asks : is there any talk of a pacific rim 3 , preferably involving you ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:51pm there is talk .
that 's all it is for now , just a conversation
pagey asks : you 're playing bigwig in a remake of watership down .
what did you do in order to make contact with your inner rabbit ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:50pm i do n't think i have an inner rabbit for me it was more about the circumstances of the character .
bigwig is at a point where he 's been considering a change .
he 's always been a leader naturally , never had much to fight for .
it 's the deepest my voice has been - i use the lowest register of my voice for watership down .

documents.title: my favourite role as a kid was master wobble in mrs wobble the waitress . i had to rollerblade across the stage and catch fake food in a big net
text: sweettreat97 asks : do you remember all of the plays you did as a kid ( at theatre peckham or otherwise ) and if so , which of them were your favourites ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:48pm i did more than five shows i think .
my favourite was mrs wobble the waitress , based on a children 's book .
i played master wobble .
it was a musical .
i had to rollerblade across stage with a big net while catching fake food because my mum , mrs wobble , had an issue with her waitressing career .
she just wobbled too much .
i had to be taught how to rollerblade .
i had my own song .
it was pretty cool .

documents.title: if you come from a normal background and experience success , it takes a while to get your head around it . as long as it does n't come out in a negative way
text: cubahurrah asks : are you enjoying your success ?

this is n't a negative question it 's just that so many actors are always complaining or very sulky when they make it ' and they should just embrace the fact that they are doing so well and live every moment of it .
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:46pm anybody should embrace the success they 've worked hard for - whether they 're an actor or not - but a level of perspective is always needed .
just because you 're successful does n't mean you 're exempt from every other emotion apart from happiness and gratitude .
life just does n't work that way .
if you come from a normal background , then experience success , it takes a while to get your head around it .
sometimes it can get very frustrating .
but that 's ok - as long as it does n't come out in a negative way .
startchoppin asks : any chance of another movie with joe cornish ( please please please ) ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:43pm absolutely !
at some point .
we met up a few months back but not lately .
when i 'm done with the play i 'll start developing a whole bunch of things .
something bigger , based here in london for sure .
actors from joe cornish 's film attack the block .
from left to right alex esmail , franz drameh , john boyega ( centre ) , simon howard and leeon jones .
saker for the observer

documents.title: i 'm keen to work with kathryn bigelow again . i 've seen our movie now ( detroit ) and it 's heart-wrenching
text: kumail2187 asks : what was it like it working on a kathryn bigelow set , especially one where you 're working with so many other young british actors ?
what 's your acting method ; do you stay in character on such a serious film set or are you less serious behind the scenes ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:42pm it was great working with kathryn !

detroit is about the detroit riots of 1967 , the backdrop to a particular story that happened at the algiers hotel , a face-off between the young police force and some young black men , in a world of racial unrest .
there were a lot of bad vibes between the civilians of detroit and the police because of lack of jobs .
this is a particular story that happened at the time .
i 'm keen to work with kathryn again .
i 've seen the movie now and it 's heart-wrenching .
it leaves you sore in spirit but makes you ask the right questions .
i loved working with the other british actors - particularly will porter .
i do n't stay in character - i savour that when the camera 's rolling .
but i stay in that character 's state of mind .
it 's a very touchy issue so it requires the three rs john boyega in detroit .
duhamel/entertainment o/pa

documents.title: i get nervous on the first day only . i do n't have time for stage fright â it just weakens you
text: harry2255 asks : how do you prepare for roles ?
and do you get nervous before going on set ?
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:36pm i prepare with the triple r system !
research the role .
rehearse the role .
respect the role .
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:37pm and i get nervous on the first day only - after that i 'm fine .
i do n't have time for stage fright - it just weakens you .
it 's such an unnecessary feeling .
if i feel it for a second i tell it to shut its mouth .
it slows you down .
i just go : no .
i do n't tolerate that .
larshanson asks : woyzeck is one of my favourite plays and i wanted to ask about your rehearsal process and your impressions of the play .
what do you think of transposing the play to west berlin in the early 1980s ?
have you had a chance to see the opera wozzeck in the course of working on the play ?
have a wonderful run of the play .
guardian contributor john boyega 30 may 2017 1:35pm hello from the old vic !
i started rehearsals as soon as i wrapped on pacific rim .
i knew the play through joe murphy , the director .
it 's all about reading it through , placing the scenes together act by act .
i did n't watch or read about any other version apart from the original and our version .
it would have been a distraction otherwise .
we rehearsed for five weeks .
it 's really intense - i 'm still so tired now , especially after coming off the film .
i only had a week off in between !
it 's nice to bring it to a contemporary time - the audience can relate more to it .
they have similar issues in that 80s setting that we 're still struggling with today - whether financially or in terms of his mental state .
at that time , there was no set system in approaching mental health in the army - it was n't defined by then .
a lot of people were suffering .
john boyega is ready to answer your questions !
john boyega answers questions wiegand for the guardian

documents.title: post your questions for john boyega
text: john boyega instantly gained iconic status when , gasping and sweaty in a teaser trailer , he became the first thing anyone saw of the latest series of star wars films .
it was a long way from his childhood in peckham , south-east london , where he joined theatre school thanks to a hardship fund .
he is now back on the london stage in jack thorne 's new version of georg bã¼chner 's fragmented play woyzeck .
on screen , he appears in the adaptation of dave eggers ' novel the circle , with emma watson and tom hanks , as well as in kathryn bigelow 's new movie , detroit .
he has also started his own production company , co-producing and starring in the forthcoming blockbuster sequel pacific rim : uprising .
with woyzeck now at london 's old vic , john is joining us to answer your questions about anything in his life and career , in a live webchat from 1pm bst on tuesday 30 may .
post them in the comments below .

bulletin.text: The Star Wars actor is currently appearing on stage in Woyzeck, and answered your questions on Attack the Block, Watership Down and his lack of stage fright.
